page.title: 17CHALFONT FARMING (CONTINUED)
page.content: The acreage is divided as follows, 30-40 acres woodland, 40 acres of orchards including {plums}, {damsons} and {cherries}. 30 acres of oats and barley which is grown to sell and not for the animals' fodder.The remaining area of grass is chopped into hay, also for sale.They have a small flock of {sheep}. Contractors do the fruit picking and heavy work. The contractors are modern.Another farm visited was Packwood, a modern farm built in 1977. The farm is a combination of cattle, dairy and arable. A few cattle are raised for beef, but mainly the livestock is for dairy purposes. Mumfords Farm, a mainly arable farm is in the process of being broken up and a considerable amount of the land has been bought by the owner of Packwood Farm.
